intro: Tephrosia sphaerospora, commonly known as the globe-headed tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its rounded, globular seed pods are distinctive and contribute to its common name. Tephrosia sphaerospora is sometimes used in traditional medicine and has potential ecological significance in its native environment.
